params.target: Target address to call the function on.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC20 token failed.

approveERC20(address).details: This function needs to be called before using the PaymentHub the first time with a new ERC20 token.

params.amount: The exact amount which you want get out (exactOutput) or you put in (exactInput).
params.exactOutput: True if exactOutput should be used or false if exactInput should be used.
params.path: The path of the swap (inreverse order for exactOutput).

params.amountInBase: The amount of the base currency for the exact output.
params.path: The encoded path of the swap from erc20 to base.

params.amountInBase: The amount of base currency used to buy shares.
params.brokerbot: The brokerbot to pay and receive the shares from.

payFromERC20(uint256,uint256,address,byt.details: The calling address must approve this contract to spend its ERC20 for this function to succeed. As the amount of input ERC20 is variable, the calling address will need to approve for a slightly higher or infinit amount, anticipating some variance.

params.amountInMaximum: The maximum amount of ERC20 willing to be swapped for the specified amountOut of baseCurrency.
params.erc20In: The address of the erc20 token to pay with.
params.path: The encoded path of the swap from erc20 to base.

returns.amountIn: The amountIn of ERC20 actually spent to receive the desired amountOut.

params.amountBase: The amount of base currency used to buy shares.
params.brokerbot: The brokerbot to pay and receive the shares from.
params.path: The Uniswap path from ETH to base currency (uses exactOuput => reverse order)

params.amount: The amount of tokens to transfer.
params.to: The address to transfer tokens to.

params.amountToSell: The amount of shares to sell.
params.brokerbot: The brokerbot of the shares to sell.
params.ref: Reference e.g. insider declaration and the type of sell.

returns._0: The output amount of the swap to the desired token.

params.amountToSell: The amount the seller wants to sell.
params.brokerbot: The brokerbot to recive the shares.
params.recipient: The address of the recipient of the sell preceeds.
params.ref: Reference e.g. insider declaration and the type of sell.

The address to transfer ether to.

PaymentHub_SwapError(uint256,uint256).notice: swap with less base token as required.

PaymentHub_TransferFailed().notice: Failguard when an erc20 transfer returns false.

approveERC20(address).notice: This function appoves infinite allowance for Uniswap, this is safe as the paymenthub should never hold any token (see also recover() ).

getPriceERC20(uint256,bytes,bool).notice: Get price for given amount and path swapped via uniswap.

getPriceInERC20(uint256,bytes).notice: Get price in ERC20 This is the method that the Brokerbot widget should use to quote the price to the user.

getPriceInEther(uint256,address,bytes).notice: Get price in Ether via swap path (no oracle on polygon) This is the method that the Brokerbot widget should use to quote the price to the user.

multiPayAndNotify(address,address[],uint.notice: Can (at least in theory) save some gas as the sender balance only is touched in one transaction.

payAndNotify(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Allows to make a base currency payment from the sender to the brokerbot, given an allowance to this contract.

payFromEther(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Convenience method to swap ether into base and pay a target address

payFromEtherAndNotify(address,uint256,by.notice: Pay with Ether to buy shares.

recover(address,address,uint256).notice: In case tokens have been accidentally sent directly to this contract. Only Forwarder can withdraw, else a MEV bot will intercept it.

sellSharesAndSwap(address,address,uint25.notice: With this function a user can sell shares and swap them to a desired token. The user has to approve the paymenthub before on the shares contract.

sellSharesWithPermitAndSwap(address,addr.notice: With this function a user can sell shares with permit and swap them to a desired token.

transferEther(address).notice: Transfer ether to a given address.

withdrawEther(address,uint256).notice: Transfer ether to a given address. Only Forwarder can withdraw, else a MEV bot will intercept it.

userdoc.notice: A hub for payments. This allows tokens that do not support ERC 677 to enjoy similar functionality, namely interacting with a token-handling smart contract in one transaction, without having to set an allowance first. Instead, an allowance needs to be set only once, namely for this contract. Further, it supports automatic conversion from Ether to the payment currency through Uniswap or the reception of Ether using the current exchange rate as found in the chainlink oracle.
